meanings.definition: The practice of using a position of power or influence for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The jobbery of the manager led to unfair advantages for himself.
meanings.sent2: The company's downfall was a result of the CEO's jobbery.
meanings.sent3: The jobbery in the office was so obvious, it was like a bad movie plot.
meanings.sent4: The jobbery of the politician cast a dark shadow over the government.
meanings.sent5: The jobbery of the supervisor was like a poison infecting the workplace.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in corrupt or dishonest business dealings.
meanings.sent1: The jobbery of the businessman was finally exposed by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The investigation revealed a web of jobbery within the company.
meanings.sent3: The jobbery in the business world was so rampant, it became a joke among competitors.
meanings.sent4: The jobbery of the contractor left a trail of broken promises and disappointed clients.
meanings.sent5: The jobbery of the salesperson was like a stain on the reputation of the industry.

meanings.definition: To engage in shady or underhanded business practices.
meanings.sent1: He decided to jobbery his way to the top, regardless of the consequences.
meanings.sent2: She was known for jobberying her competitors out of business.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends joked about jobberying their way into getting free pizza.
meanings.sent4: The rival company accused them of jobberying the deal to secure the contract.
meanings.sent5: The employee's attempt to jobbery his colleagues backfired spectacularly.
